entry.title: Hoofs In The Wild
entry.summary:
Author: Budzii

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,291Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 3

Summary: ''So I signed you up to ride camp.'' She gave him an awkward smile.''Maddie, I'm 32. I have my own life,'' Buck said, swinging his head in his hands.''That's my point,'' brushing her hand up and down, Bucks back.''You need to try a new thing.'' Buck slowly looks at her, who is giving him puppy eyes.''For me, please.'' Buck can't resist the puppy eyes. He lets out a little laugh. ''Ha! Okayyy ''Maddie's face lights up like the sun in the morning. She got up. "Get everything ready; we're leaving tomorrow!''''Wait! What-... Maddie!... and she's gone'' Buck let out a big sight.''What did I sign up for?'' He murmured quietly.

entry.title: You're Looking at Me (But I'm Looking Through You)
entry.summary:
Author: GalFromTheGhetto

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,050Chapters: 3/10Kudos: 7

Summary: Inspired by Fringe Season 3(though you don't need to have watched Fringe)Evan's instructions were simple: Go back to the other side in Buck's place (the guy has a stupid nickname), pretend to be him, and learn what he can about the other universe.Buck is alone again, and is sure that he has been replaced by his evil doppelganger. He is sure that his loved ones don't even realize it or miss him.As he is rotting in this cell, in another world, Eddie is probably canoodling with...Evan.Who is better than Buck in all the ways that matter.¬†But Eddie will notice, right?OR;There is two of everything.Two universes.Two Evan Buckleys.How come Eddie doesn't get a doppelganger?And how did Eddie end up at the center of a war between two universes?

entry.title: A Strong Hand and a Sound Mind
entry.summary:
Author: AutorWA_13

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,518Chapters: 7/24Kudos: 33

Summary: Buck had always known people leave. Ex-girlfriends, friends, broken promises‚Äîhe‚Äôd lost count. But when Eddie announces his plan of going to El Paso, something inside Buck shatters in a different way. He does what it takes, until one day, he can‚Äôt take it anymore. With no plan, no fixed destination, just a backpack and an endless road ahead, Buck decides to escape the pain the only way he knows: by running. But the farther he travels, the more he finds himself confronted by memories, the ghosts of what he‚Äôs lost, and one unexpected question: is he running toward a new home or simply running from the fear that he never truly had one?Eddie never hesitated when it came to his son. Christopher was his compass, his greatest reason to keep fighting, and when he gets tired of having his son away, Eddie doesn‚Äôt think twice before leaving everything behind‚Äîincluding Buck. El Paso takes him through unfamiliar roads and a journey that isn‚Äôt just about repairing his relationship with his son, but about finding himself. In the midst of chaos, worry, and missing his life in Los Angeles, Eddie realizes that maybe his feelings for Buck have always been deeper than he was willing to admit.

entry.title: Eddie Diaz is Very Normal About His Very Best Friend
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,834Chapters: 1/2Kudos: 28

Summary: They‚Äôre friends. Between them is a line in the sand, ‚ÄòFRIENDS‚Äô scrawled gigantic and unmistakable, and here he is, crash-landed right through the middle. Fuck it. He‚Äôs‚Äîhe‚Äôs got nothing left to lose, and at the very least he can blame exhausted delirium. or:‚ÄúYou could‚Äîstay.
